alert.note: Alert for Delta (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS GrandJunction (Western Colorado and Eastern Utah)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 26 at 2:23PM MDT until May 27 at 4:15PM MDT by NWS GrandJunction
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY FOR SNOWMELT NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 PM MDT SUNDAY FOR SURFACE CREEK IN DELTA COUNTY... * WHAT...Hydrologic flooding caused by snowmelt continues. * WHERE...Along Surface Creek to the confluence with the Gunnison River. * WHEN...Until 600 PM MDT Sunday. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. River or stream flows are elevated due to high flows from snowmelt. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 221 PM MDT, Gauge reports indicated high river flows due to accelerated snowmelt off the Grand Mesa. Minor flooding is already occurring in the advisory area. - This includes the following streams and drainages... Surface Creek - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Orchard City, Cedaredge and Eckert. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Stay away or be swept away. River banks and culverts can become unstable and unsafe.
